content:
• Monday, April 10, 2017
  • GERN

    Geron settling class-action securities suit for $6.25M

    • Geron (GERN +19.5%) says in a filing that it's entered into a settlement resolving a consolidated class-action securities lawsuit.
    • In exchange for dismissal with prejudice of all claims against all defendants in the matter, Geron is settling for $6.25M in cash -- $6M of which will be paid by Geron's insurers, with the company ponying up $250K and admitting no wrongdoing.
    • The class consisted of buyers of the company's stock between Dec. 10, 2012 through and including March 11, 2014.
    • The settlement heads for a fairness hearing on July 21, 2017.
    • Previously: Geron completes second internal data reviews for Imetelstat trials; shares ahead 16% premarket (Apr. 10 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM | 406 Comments
  • USM

    U.S. Cellular unveils prepaid unlimited-data plan

    • U.S. Cellular (USM +1.7%) has launched an "unlimited" data plan as a prepaid option, the next step in a slowly heating war over wireless data.
    • The new plan joins an unlimited plan that the company set up for postpaid users in February. The new plan is $70/month for prepaid, adding to existing plans of $35/month for 1 GB and $45/month for 5 GB.
    • The company's postpaid unlimited plan comes at $60/month, which drops to $40/line for four lines.
    • As is now common with the new wave of unlimited plans, the bytes are uncapped but the service comes with restrictions: only standard-definition video rather than HD, and speeds drop to 2G level as users crest 22 GB of usage in a given month.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell Tech +20% on $47M cash injection from Chinese group

    • Maxwell Technologies (NASDAQ:MXWL) +20.2% AH after sealing a stock purchase agreement with China's SDIC Fund Management that is expected to bring ~$47M into the company.
    • The deal, which values MXWL at $6.32/share, would raise SDIC Fund's ownership stake in the company to 19.9%.
    • MXWL also says it is entering a cooperation agreement with Viex Capital Advisors, including the appointment of a director selected by the P-E firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • SVU

    Supervalu to buy distributor Unified Grocers in $375M deal

    • Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) agrees to acquire west coast focused wholesale grocery and specialty distributor Unified Grocers for ~$375M, including debt, combining two complementary organizations with ~$16B in total 2016 sales.
    • SVU expects the deal to be accretive to EPS in the first full fiscal year following closing, and forecasts at least $60M in cost synergies by the end of the third year of operations after the completion of the transaction.
    • SVU +2.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 15 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SALE +49.0%. AUPH +4.4%. ETSY +4.1%. ENDP +3.4%. IMMU +2.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: SEAC -4.1%. MTSC -3.3%. FIT -2.8%. SEDG -1.9%. SFUN -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 7 Comments
  • CY

    Cypress Semi enters credit deal to cut loan margins

    • Cypress Semiconductor (CY +2.2%) has entered an amended credit agreement that cuts the margin for some term loans outstanding.
    • In a filing, the company notes the $100M aggregate principal worth of term loans borrowed in 2015 will bear interest either at the base rate plus a 1.75% margin, or the Eurodollar rate plus a margin of 2.75%, at Cypress' option.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • AXON

    Axovant down 1.8% on capital raise

    • Axovant (NASDAQ:AXON) is selling $100M of common stock, with underwriter greenshoe for another $15M. The sale comes after the regular session's 22.5% advance on the appointment to CEO of former Medivation CEO David Hung.
    • Shares -1.8% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • GNC

    Investors snack on Avon, GNC and Vitamin Shoppe

    • GNC Holdings (GNC +7.4%), Avon Products (AVP +7.4%) and Vitamin Shoppe (VSI +2.4%) are all solidly higher in moves that could be related to elevated levels of short interest.
    • The trio sometimes take its marching cues from Herbalife, which received a shot in the arm from Pivotal earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • NGVC

    Grocery store sector jolted by Jana interest in Whole Foods

    • Grocery store stocks are flying off of word that Jana Partners plans to pressure Whole Foods Market after taking a stake in the compay. Real estate strategy and capital allocation are reportedly on the radar of Jana.
    • Gainers include Natural Grocers by Vitamin Cottage (NGVC +3.7%), Smart & Final Stores (SFS +3.4%), Supervalu (SVU +2.3%), Sprouts Farmers Market (SFM +1.7%) and Kroger (KR +1.4%). All the grocery names broke higher after the Whole Foods news hit..
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 7 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife short thesis 'running on empty'

    • Taking in a viewing of "Betting on Zero" over the weekend, Pivotal analyst Tim Ramey calls the documentary a "sad reflection on [Bill Ackman] who been consistently been wrong on this name."
    • All the things Ackman said would happen - that Herbalife (HLF +1.8%) would never get a Big 4 auditor, that it would never get a clean audit opinion, that the FTC would shut it all down, that HLF could never refinance it debt, that a death spiral was imminent after the FTC settlement - never happened.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 685 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: STRP +151%. SITO +26%. PLUG +20%. SPWR +15%. INVE +10%.
    • Losers: NH -16%. ADAT -12%. CBAK-OLD -11%. AEHR -9%. MVIS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 8 Comments
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods +8% as Jana Partners discloses stake

    • Jana Partners discloses an 8.3% stake in Whole Foods (WFM +8.5%) and says it wants to talk with management about a number of options.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 13 Comments
  • NFG

    National Fuel Gas -8.5% on New York denial of pipeline permit

    • National Fuel Gas (NFG -8.5%) plunges after New York's Department of Environmental Conservation rejected its proposed Northern Access Pipeline between Pennsylvania to western New York.
    • The DEC determined the 97-mile gas supply pipeline posed too big a threat to water quality and wildlife and denied NFG the water quality certificate required to construct the pipeline.
    • CEO Ronald Tanski defends NFG's "great record with respect to our construction practices" and says the "most troubling aspect of this decision is that the NYS DEC waited literally until the 11th hour to issue this denial," despite 34 months of discussions and engineering and environmental studies at the agency's request.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 9 Comments
  • SPWR

    SunPower says solar installation starts at new Toyota North America HQ

    • SunPower (SPWR +10.7%) is surging after saying it started work on an 8.79 MW solar system at Toyota's (TM +0.2%) new North American headquarters in Plano, Tex.
    • Once complete later this year, the project will be nearly 1 MW larger than its initial plan as well as being the largest corporate office on-site solar installation in Texas among non-utility companies.
    • As a result of 14 years of partnership, SPWR solar power systems are operating at U.S. Toyota facilities in West Caldwell, N.J., Ontario, Calif., and Torrance, Calif.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 35 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia -1.6% as BMO sees steeper graphics card decline

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is off 1.6% as BMO Capital Markets notes its manufacturer checks show graphics cards dropping 16% Q/Q in calendar Q1, a steeper decline than the 6% average.
    • "We believe this represents weakness in the channel versus the super-charged growth we have seen in the past several quarters, particularly for Nvidia's graphics business," notes analyst Ambrish Srivastava.
    • Srivastava reiterated an Underperform rating and $85 price target, implying 14% downside from current pricing.
    • Last week, Pacific Crest downgraded shares to Underweight (with a $105.15 price target), and Canaccord Genuity lowered its price target to $125 (but with a Buy rating). Meanwhile, Citigroup (Buy) set its price target at $145, implying 47% upside.
    • Previously: Nvidia adding on as Citi says gaming-market concerns 'misleading' (Apr. 05 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 30 Comments
  • HMN

    Horace Mann down 5% after downgrade; Progressive upgraded

    • Downgrading Horace Mann (HMN -5.1%) to Underperform from Market Perform, KBW's Meyer Shields takes issues with the stock's valuation, which seems pricey even when assuming benefits from tax reform.
    • At the same time, he boosts Progressive (PGR +0.9%) to Outperform on expected improvement in margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • CNAT

    Pharma names on the move on Akorn sales talks

    • Conatus Pharma (CNAT +2.4%), Lannett (LCI +10%), Endo (ENDP +1.3%), Synergy (SGYP +2.9%), Horizon (HZNP +3.1%), Perrigo (PRGO +1.6%), and Valeant (VRX +1.4%) are among those with their tails in the air following confirmation that Fresenius is in talks to buy Akorn.
    • The PowerShares Dynamic Pharmaceuticals Portfolio (PJP +0.9%), SPDR S&P Pharmaceuticals (XPH +0.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 20 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: MFIN +12%. FRBA +6%. QIWI +5%. PMTS +5%.
    • Losers: SGLB -11%. CCCR-OLD -10%. CFBK -5%. HMN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • AAPL

    Piper Jaffray survey shows more teens than ever plan to go iPhone

    • Piper Jaffray sees a positive data point for the iPhone 7 and 8 (AAPL +0.2%) in a survey that shows a record 81% of teens expect their next phone to be one of Apple's models.
    • That's up from last fall's 79% and the highest it's seen, Piper says. More than three-quarters of teens in the survey say they own an iPhone now.
    • The Apple Watch is having a tougher go with teens: Fitbit (FIT +3.4%) takes 71% of the vote as favorite fitness band, vs. 10% for Apple, and only about 13% of polled teens expect to buy an Apple Watch in the next six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 53 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish Network +1.4% following AT&T/STRP deal

    • Dish Network (DISH +1.4%) is on the move alongside Globalstar (GSAT +0.9%) (but both well off their session highs) after AT&T agreed to pay more than a 160% premium to buy Straight Path Communications.
    • Like Globalstar, Dish has unused wireless spectrum.
    • Late last week, UFP's Stephane Mardel suggested Dish could be worth as much as $95 per share (vs. the current low $60s) to Verizon and T-Mobile. Even on a standalone basis, Dish is worth $82, says Mardel.
    • Previously: Globalstar up 15% in wake of AT&T-Straight Path deal (April 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMZN

    Another sell-sider climbs on board Amazon; shares +1.3%

    • “Leveraging its U.S. playbook, we expect international market expansions to drive Amazon’s long-term growth,” says Needham's Kerry Rice, upgrading Amazon (AMZN +1.3%) to Buy from Hold. The $1K price target suggests nearly 12% upside from Friday's close.
    • He sees the company as having several multi-billion dollar total addressable market opportunities, among them advertising, groceries, and home services.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 13 Comments
  • KBR

    KBR to get $435M in settlement of Pemex dispute

    • KBR (KBR +4.7%) says it will receive $435M to settle a decade-long dispute with Mexico's Pemex over payment for work in the Bay of Campeche related to the EPC 1 offshore platform construction project.
    • In 2009, KBR received an International Chamber of Commerce arbitration award covering the costs and fees it was owed for its work for Pemex.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • GCAP

    GAIN Capital lower 4.7% on reporting March metrics

    • GCAP -4.7% reports retail OTC trading volume of $239.2B up 40.5% M/M, down 10.3% Y/Y.
    • Active OTC accounts of 136,829 up 4.3% M/M and 3.3% Y/Y.
    • Institutional: ECN volume of $271.7B up 22.6% from last month and 60.7% Y/Y.
    • Swap dealer volume of $67.4B up 9.6% M/M, gained 4.8% Y/Y.
    • Futures contracts of 827,296 up 40.3% M/M, up 5.7% Y/Y.
    • Active future contracts of 8,201 down 0.2% M/M, down 7.8% Y/Y.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: STRP +147%. CYTX +38%. AXON +28%. SWFT +22%. SITO +21%. GERN +20%. GALT +15%. GEMP +15%. EVRI +15%. BEAT +13%.
    • Losers: OMED -35%. CCCR-OLD -20%. TXMD -18%. SSKN -14%. CLNT -12%. OPTT -12%. IPCI -11%. CBAK-OLD -11%. NH -11%. SGLB -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center surges 5% as activist investor picks up an ally

    • An owner of 4.9% of the company, Marcato Capital urges the Rent-A-Center (RCII +5%) board to immediately get started on a review of all strategic alternatives, including a possible sale.
    • If no action is taken, Marcato says it will throw its support behind Engaged Capital's board slate at the upcoming annual meeting.
    • Marcato's letter comes after the company today announced co-founder, Chairman, and interim CEO Mark Speese as permanent CEO, and a new strategic plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: LBIX-OLD +17%. NTZ +13%. NAKD +12%. AVP +5%.
    • Losers: NVFY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo International +4% after seeing Q1 revenue in-line with estimates

    • Endo International (ENDP +4.2%) jumps 4% after pre-announcing Q1 results with revenue in-line with estimates.
    • ENDP sees Q1 adjusted EBITDA of $440M-$460M, with revenues rising 5%-7% to $1.015B-$1.035B vs. $964M in the prior-year quarter and $1.02B analyst consensus; results include a $45M impairment for serelaxin after the drug's Phase 3 disappointment.
    • ENDP also reiterates that it is assessing strategic alternatives for its Grupo Farmacéutico Somar, Sociedad Anónima Promotora de Inversión de Capital Variable business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 14 Comments
  • OMED

    Down 35%, Oncomed defended at Wells Fargo

    • With the share price nearing $5, after the Phase 2 trial for demcizumab missed its primary endpoint, Wells Fargo's Jim Birchenough sees limited downside.
    • With $5 per share in cash and a $4-$5 per share value for cancer stem cell therapeutics, Birchenough retains his Outperform rating, and sets a price target range of $9-$10 (down from $19-$25).
    • Source: TheFly
    • OncoMed (NASDAQ:OMED) currently down 34.8% to $5.71.
    • Previously: OncoMed misses endpoint on clinical trial; Bayer will not license two drugs (April 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • ETN

    Eaton, Cummins form JV for automated transmissions

    • Eaton (ETN +2.1%) and Cummins (CMI +0.8%) are higher after disclosing a joint venture for automated transmissions for heavy- and medium-duty commercial vehicles, to be named Eaton Cummins Automated Transmission Technologies.
    • CMI will pay $600M to ETN for a 50% stake in the JV to further integrate its engines with ETN's automated transmission system in the North American truck market.
    • Stifel reiterates its Hold rating and $150 price target on CMI, saying the JV deal "makes sense."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 3 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CYTX +34%. AXON +29%. GERN +21%. GEMP +12%. GALT +12%.
    • Losers: OMED -37%. TXMD -18%. IPCI -14%. SSKN -14%. MYOS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • AKS

    Report: Trump weighs potentially explosive steel, aluminum import tariffs

    • AK Steel (AKS -6.6%) and other steel and aluminum producers (SLX -0.3%) are lower following a report that the Trump administration is considering "potentially explosive" steel and aluminum import tariffs.
    • Axios reports that the administration is working on an executive order that would initiate investigations into "unfair" product dumping from foreign companies, an action that could lead to tariffs on a wide range of products.
    • Notable Calls opines that such action could significantly boost U.S. Steel (X -1.1%) and aluminum producers such as Alcoa (AA -0.9%), as it would drive up pricing.
    • But sector shares now are broadly lower, including: RS -0.3%, NUE -0.4%, MT -0.6%, CLF -1.2%, STLD -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 138 Comments
  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker dips after Morgan Stanley warns on pricing

    • Morgan Stanley cites pricing pressure from Wal-Mart in lowering J.M. Smucker (SJM -0.9%) to an Underweight rating from Equal Weight.
    • "Walmart comprises ~22% of sales across our coverage, a figure that has increased in recent years even as the retailer’s total grocery sales have grown at an even faster 4% CAGR. With Food margins expected to expand meaningfully, we believe this only enhances Walmart’s negotiating leverage going forward. SJM, Dean Foods, and General Mills are most at risk in the current environment," warns MS.
    • The firm slides its price target on SJM down to $126.
    • Shares of J.M. Smucker are level from where they stood a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 3 Comments
  • JLL

    Jones Lang LaSalle +1.8% after positive Barron's mention

    • It's been a tough run of late for Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL), down nearly 10% Y/Y vs. the S&P 500's 15% advance.
    • Worries about the long-in-the-tooth commercial property cycle are likely baked into the share price, writes David Englander, and investors aren't giving JLL much credit for its less-cyclical, annuity-like operations like facility management and property project management services - which together account for more than 60% of annual revenue.
    • Shares +1.8% in early action today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • RPRX

    FDA continues partial clinical hold for Repros Therapeutics' fibroids drug

    • Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +7.2%) discloses that the FDA will continue a partial clinical hold for the company's Proellex drug for uterine fibroids, or tumors in the uterus; shares resume trading after a halt began before the open.
    • RPRX says the FDA plans to consult with its liver experts about the liver toxicity that has been previously experienced with the drug; RPRX expects to submit additional information and a proposed clinical protocol within a month.
    • The FDA has previously put development programs for Proellex on clinical holds because of safety concerns.
    • Also, RPRX names Larry Dillaha as its full-time President and CEO effective immediately, after serving in the positions on an interim basis since Feb. 1; Dillaha previously was CEO of inception stage biotech CavtheRx and COO and Chief Medical Officer of New Haven Pharmaceuticals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • KNX

    Colossal merger shakes up trucking

    • Swift Transportation (SWFT +21.3%) and Knight Transportation (KNX +11.7%) rattled the trucking sector today with their plan to merge into a new company called Knight-Swift Transportation Holdings.
    • The new entity is expected to have an implied enterprise value of ~$6B and see accretive benefits immediately to EPS from shared costs.
    • The executive team will be led by Kevin Knight as Executive Chairman and Dave Jackson as CEO, both from Knight Transportation.
    • Aegis Capital thinks Knight is getting a good deal (46% of equity for 66% of the combined EBITDA).
    • Trucking stocks are solidly higher on the day as investors gauge if more M&A might come down the road. Celadon Group (CGI +9.3%), USA Truck (USAK +2.9%), YRC Worldwide (YRCW +2.8%), Landstar System (LSTR +1.7%), J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT +1.9%) and Marten Transport (MRTN +2.4%) are some of the notable movers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 6 Comments
  • SUN

    Sunoco surges on three upgrades following 7-Eleven deal

    • Sunoco (SUN +1.9%) jumps past $30 at the open, as three firms have upgraded shares following the $3.3B sale of the majority of its real estate portfolio to 7-Eleven.
    • Baird upgrades SUN to Outperform from Neutral with a $36 price target, up from $28, as it now sees a “reasonable path” for SUN to cover its distribution; the firm also sees the deal as a precursor for SUN to “move back into its parents basement" - i.e., a roll-up of SUN into Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -0.1%).
    • Jefferies raises shares to Hold from Underperform with a $29 target, up from $20, saying SUN should be able to delever and execute a significant unit buyback but still struggles to see how SUN achieves 4.5x-4.75x leverage and 1.1x coverage targets without “additional measures."
    • On Friday, Barclays upgraded SUN to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $35 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 22 Comments
  • GEMP

    Gemphire Therapeutics flies after Piper launches favorable coverage

    • Piper Jaffray initiates coverage on Gemphire Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GEMP) with an Overweight rating on a very positive long term view of the biopharma name.
    • The firm sets a price target of $30, which is almost triple the closing price of Gemphire on Friday. Shares are up 9.55% in ealy trading after the confidence boost from Piper.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • GSAT

    Globalstar up 15% in wake of AT&T-Straight Path deal

    • Following a big deal this morning bringing together a telecom giant with a millimeter-wave spectrum holder -- AT&T's $1.6B deal for Straight Path Communications -- Globalstar (NYSEMKT:GSAT) is up 15.4% to what would be its highest point since June.
    • The company -- which is banking on its Terrestrial Low-Power Service to tap unlicensed spectrum for Wi-Fi networking -- slid last June after chatter that the company was headed for a no-vote on the company's frequency use. It rebounded in December after a revised FCC proposal.
    • Shorts could see a squeeze here. There were more than 94M shares short; short percentage of float sat at 23.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 13 Comments
  • TXMD

    TherapeuticsMD provides TX-004HR regulatory update; shares down 20% premarket

    • TherapeuticsMD (NYSEMKT:TXMD) announces that the Company received a letter from the FDA stating that, as part of the FDA’s ongoing review of the Company’s new drug application (NDA) for TX-004HR, an applicator-free vaginal estradiol softgel drug candidate for the treatment of moderate to severe dyspareunia, the FDA has identified deficiencies that preclude discussion of labeling and postmarketing requirements/commitments at this time.
    • The FDA previously set a target action date under the Prescription Drug User Fee Act (PDUFA) of May 7 to complete the FDA’s review of the NDA.
    • Shares are down 20% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 82 Comments

    • STRP +151% on being acquired by AT&T.

    • XGTI +7%.

    • TXMD -22% on providing update on TX-004HR.
    • OPTT -20%.
    • CCCR-OLD -13%.
    • HTGM -7%.
    • IPCI -5% on announcing patent litigation by Purdue against Rexista.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SKX

    Susquehanna sees fair value on Skechers

    • Skechers (NYSE:SKX) is on watch after Susquehanna upgrades the shoe seller to Neutral after having it slotted with a Negative rating.
    • The firm pulls its bearish call on Skechers with pressure in the U.S. wholesale business now reflected in share price (13X PE).
    • SKX +1.21% premarket to $25.15 vs. the $25 price target from Susquehanna.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPLS

    Staples on the move again

    • Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) are moving higher in premarket trading again after the retailer was mentioned favorably in Barron's last week.
    • A large shareholder told the publication that the fair value of the stock is $15, suggesting almost more than 50% upside from Friday's closing price.
    • SPLS +2.56% premarket to $10.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 8 Comments
  • STRP

    AT&T buying Straight Path Communications for a whopping $1.6B

    • The all-stock deal which is intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization works out to $95.63 per Straight Path (NYSEMKT:STRP) share, a 162% premium to Friday's close (and triple the price from Jan. 11 when STRP announced 'strategic alternatives' process).
    • The amount of AT&T (NYSE:T) stock will be adjusted to ensure consideration of $95.63 per share.
    • Straight Path was spun into an independent company in 2013 at a price of $6.40 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 51 Comments
  • XCO

    Exco Resources to sell south Texas oil and gas properties for $300M

    • Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) +19.3% premarket after agreeing to sell its oil and natural gas properties in south Texas for $300M to Venado Oil & Gas.
    • XCO says the properties produced ~4,100 boe/day (~90% oil) during December 2016.
    • XCO says it plans to focus on drilling and development of its core Haynesville and Bossier shale assets in north Louisiana and east Texas.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 14 Comments
  • GERN

    Geron completes second internal data reviews for Imetelstat trials; shares ahead 16% premarket

    • Geron Corporation (GERN) announces that Janssen Research & Development, LLC has completed the second internal data reviews of IMerge and IMbark, the clinical trials of the telomerase inhibitor imetelstat in lower risk myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) and relapsed or refractory myelofibrosis (MF), respectively.
    • For IMerge, the benefit/risk profile of imetelstat in the treated patients supports continued development in MDS. A data package and proposed trial design refinements are planned to be provided to the FDA.
    • For IMbark, the current results suggest clinical benefit and a potential overall survival benefit associated with imetelstat treatment in MF; the trial will continue unchanged to evaluate maturing efficacy and safety data, including an assessment of overall survival.
    • IMerge (NCT02598661) is a Phase 2/3 clinical trial evaluating imetelstat in transfusion dependent patients with Low or Intermediate-1 risk MDS who have relapsed after or are refractory to prior treatment with an erythropoiesis stimulating agent (ESA). The clinical trial is in two parts: Part 1 is a Phase 2, open-label, single-arm design in ~30 patients and Part 2 is designed to be a Phase 3, randomized, controlled trial in ~170 patients. The primary efficacy endpoint is the rate of red blood cell transfusion independence lasting at least 8 weeks. Key secondary endpoints include the rates of red blood cell transfusion independence lasting at least 24 weeks and hematologic improvement. Part 1 of the trial is fully enrolled.
    • IMbark (NCT02426086) was originally designed as a Phase 2 clinical trial to evaluate two dose levels of imetelstat (either 4.7 mg/kg or 9.4 mg/kg administered every three weeks) in ~200 patients with Intermediate-2 or High risk MF. The co-primary efficacy endpoints for the trial are spleen response rate (≥35% reduction of spleen volume assessed by imaging) and symptom response rate (50% reduction in Total Symptom Score) at 24 weeks.
    • The second internal review of IMbark included data from the ~100 patients who were enrolled in the trial, with each dosing arm analyzed separately.
    • During the next year, Geron expects Janssen to evaluate maturing efficacy and safety data from the trial, including an assessment of overall survival.
    • Shares are up 16% premarket.

  • BHP

    BHP Billiton +3% as Elliott urges spinoff of oil business

    • BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) +3.2% premarket after activist investor Elliott Management targets the company, urging it to spin off its U.S. petroleum assets and unify its dual U.K.-Australia structure.
    • Elliott, which says it owns a 4.1% stake in BHP, says its plan would enable BHP's management to provide shareholders with an increase in value of up to ~49% on the Australia-listed shares and 51% on the U.K.-listed shares.
    • "Despite being a leading global resources company with a portfolio of best-in-class large-scale diversified mining assets, in recent years BHP as an investment has underperformed a portfolio of comparable mineral and petroleum companies," Elliott Management says in a letter to BHP's board.
    • In a response, BHP says the costs and risks of Elliott's proposal would significantly outweigh any potential benefits.

  • CYTX

    FDA approves Cytori's burn clinical trial related to BARDA contract; shares ahead 23% premarket

    • Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX) announces that the FDA has approved an Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) for a pilot clinical trial to evaluate Cytori Cell Therapy in patients with thermal burn injury.
    • This trial, named the RELIEF trial, is a continuation of Cytori’s ongoing R&D efforts under its contract with the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA), a division of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.
    • The RELIEF trial will assess safety and feasibility of intravenous delivery of Cytori Cell Therapy in patients with thermal burn injuries covering between 20% and 50% of their body surface area. The trial is approved to enroll up to 30 patients in up to 10 U.S. sites. Initiation of RELIEF is dependent upon execution of a contract option by BARDA to provide the necessary funds.
    • Shares are up 23% premarket.

  • KNX

    Swift Transportation, Knight Transportation to merge

    • Swift Transportation (SWFT) and Knight Transportation (NYSE:KNX) agree to a merger in an all-stock transaction that will create the industry's largest full truckload company, with more than $5B in annual revenue.
    • The combined entity will be called Knight-Swift Transportation Holdings and will be headquartered in Phoenix; it will trade under the KNX ticker.
    • Each SWFT share will convert into 0.72 shares of Knight-Swift via a reverse split, and each share of KNX to be exchanged for one Knight-Swift share; SWFT shareholders will own ~54% and KNX shareholders will own ~46% of the combined company.
    • SWFT +5.9% premarket.
